definition: lose-lose (situation)/(of the two sides involved) to both be disadvantaged
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

sentences.english: This is the very definition of a lose lose scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这就是双输局面的最好定义。

sentences.english: In marriage, success resides more in lose-lose solutions.
sentences.chinese: 在婚姻中，成功往往在于“双输”策略。

sentences.english: But in marriage, success lies more in "lose-lose" solution.
sentences.chinese: 但在婚姻中，成功更取决于“双输”解决办法。

sentences.english: It's a loss for both sides.
sentences.chinese: 对双方而言是双输局面。

definition: profitable to both sides/a win-win situation
zero-sum game (economics)
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy
pinyin: pei2 le5 fu1 ren2 you4 zhe2 bing1

definition: lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
the chicken has flown the coop and the eggs are broken/a dead loss (idiom)
to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom)/hoisted by one's own petard
pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3

definition: to use one's neighbor as a drain/to shift one's problems onto others (idiom)
vicious circle
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
see 自食惡果|自食恶果[zi4 shi2 e4 guo3]
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to everyone's delight and satisfaction
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
a one-off, short-sighted deal/a one-shot, all-out attempt
